manifest.title: Rocket.Chat
manifest.author: RocketChat Developers
manifest.description:
This app packages Rocket.Chat <upstream>3.6.1</upstream>

### Overview

A complete team chat solution, from group messages and video calls all the way to helpdesk killer features.

### Features
* **Video Conference**
    Chat with your colleagues and friends face-to-face over audio and video.
* **Helpdesk Chat**
    Have your website visitors contact you in real-time and increase conversions.
* **File Sharing**
    Drag-and-drop files or select them from your computer or mobile device.
* **Voice Messages**
    Record and transmit voice messages to a channel, group or private conversation.
* **Link Preview**
    Post a link and immediately view its content. YouTube, Twitter, Gifs!
* **API**
    Integrate your chat to multiple services: GitHub, GitLab, JIRA, Confluence and others.
* **Extendability**
    Want a new killing feature? Add a new package. It's as simple as that.
* **Native Applications**
    Native client applications available for download on Linux, Windows and OSX.
* **Mobile Applications**
    Mobile client applications available for iOS and Android on their respective stores.
manifest.tagline: The Complete Open Source Chat Solution
manifest.changelog:
* Update Rocket.Chat to 3.6.1
* [Full changelog](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/releases/tag/3.6.1)
* File upload (Avatars, Emoji, Sounds) (#18841)
* IE11 support livechat widget (#18850)
* Omnichannel Current Chats open status filter not working (#18795)
* Showing alerts during setup wizard (#18862)
* User administration throwing a blank page if user has no role (#18851)
* User can't invite or join other Omnichannel rooms (#18852)
manifest.postInstallMessage:
On first visit, the app will show a welcome wizard to setup the admin account.

<sso>

Please follow the following guidelines to complete the Rocket.Chat admin setup:

* Use `admin` as the admin username in Rocket.Chat. This will avoid any conflict
  with Cloudron usernames.

* Use an email address that is different from the Cloudron primary email. This will avoid
  any conflict with Cloudron email ids.

</sso>

manifest.title: Confluence
manifest.author: Atlassian
manifest.description:
This app packages Confluence <upstream>7.6.2</upstream>

### About

Atlassian Confluence is where you create, organize and discuss work with your team.

Capture the knowledge that's too often lost in email inboxes and shared
network drives in Confluence instead â€“ where it's easy to find, use, and
update. Give every team, project, or department its own space to create
the things they need, whether it's meeting notes, product requirements,
file lists, or project plans, you can get it done in Confluence.
manifest.postInstallMessage: To finish the installation, do the following: * Select `Production Installation`. * Add your license key. * Select `My own database` * Database type - `PostgreSQL` * Setup type - `By connection string` * Use the Log Viewer to get database settings. Look for a section called `Datatabase Settings` in the logs. ### Configure Email To configure mail, go to `Confluence Administration`: * `Mail Servers` -> `Add SMTP mail` * Use the Log Viewer to get SMTP settings. ### Configure LDAP To enable Cloudron user authentication, go to `Confluence Administration`: * `Users & Security` -> `User directories` * `Add Directory` -> `Internal with LDAP authentication` * Use the Log Viewer to get LDAP settings.

manifest.title: BookStack
manifest.author: BookStack authors
manifest.description:
This app packages BookStack version <upstream>0.29.3</upstream>

## About

BookStack is an opinionated wiki system that provides a pleasant and simple out
of the box experience. New users to an instance should find the experience intuitive
and only basic word-processing skills should be required to get involved in creating
content on BookStack.

## Feature

* Free & Open Source
* Easy, Simple Interface
* Configurable
* Multi-lingual
* Integrated Authentication
manifest.changelog:
* Fix tags
* Update postinstall
* Add forumUrl
manifest.postInstallMessage:
This app is pre-setup with an admin account. The initial credentials are: **Username**: admin@admin.com
**Password**: password
Please change the admin password and email immediately. This app is pre-setup to give admin status to all users. You can change this by going to `Settings` -> `Registration` and adjusting the value of `Default user role after registration`.
